Frequency Spectrum

Audio waves are graphed on a grey screen based on the user’s audio input into their mic

Visualize the frequency spectrum of live audio input.

To run this example locally, you will need the p5.sound library and a running local server.

let mic, fft;

function setup() {
  createCanvas(710, 400);
  noFill();

  mic = new p5.AudioIn();
  mic.start();
  fft = new p5.FFT();
  fft.setInput(mic);
}

function draw() {
  background(200);

  let spectrum = fft.analyze();

  beginShape();
  for (i = 0; i < spectrum.length; i++) {
    vertex(i, map(spectrum[i], 0, 255, height, 0));
  }
  endShape();
}
